messages.content: Mentor is a Techis chatbot
1. What topics are covered in the Python section?

The Python section covers: fundamental concepts like `variable`,`data-types(in detail)`,`operators`,`flow control`,`functions`,`exception handling`, and advance topics like `Dictionaries`, OOP concepts like `Objects and Classes`, `Inheritance`, `Encapsulation`, `Abstract Class`, `Polymorphism`, `Interface`, `File Handling`, and sets of interview questions to prepare you for Python interviews.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
2. What will I learn in the HTML module?

In the HTML module, you'll learn about `HTML Introduction`, `Elements & Structures`, `Documents & Standards`, `Headings`, `Block and Inline Elements`, `Lists`, `Images`, `Tables`, `Hyperlinks`, `Line Breaks`, `Forms`, `Semantics`, `Styles`, and sets of interview questions for HTML.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
3. Can you detail the CSS module of the course?

The CSS module includes topics such as `CSS Introduction`, `Setup and Syntax`, `Selectors`, `Visual Rules`, `Box Model`, `Colors`, `Typography`, advanced tutorials on `Display Flex` and `Position`, and sets of interview questions tailored to CSS.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
4. What does the Git module cover?
The Git module covers `GIT Introduction`, a quick guide to learn Git in 15 minutes, learning Github in 20 minutes, a tutorial on Git Branching, and sets of interview questions focused on Git.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
5. What are the contents of the Portfolio section?

The Portfolio section guides you through creating a personal web developer portfolio. It covers `Visual Studio Code Extensions and Tips`, planning with `Trello and Adobe XD`, setting up a `GitHub Repository`, coding the `Navbar`, `About`, and `Projects` sections, and deploying on Replit.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
6. What will I learn in the JavaScript module?

In the JavaScript module, you'll cover topics like `JavaScript Introduction`, `Operators`, `Conditionals`, `Functions`, `Scope`, `Arrays`, `Loops`, `Iterators`, and a set of interview questions for JavaScript.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
7. What is included in the SQL module of the course?

The SQL module covers `SQL Introduction`, `Queries`, `JOINS`, `Queries with Expressions & Aggregates`, `Row and Tables`, `Subqueries`, `Unions`, `Intersections`, `Exceptions`, and sets of interview questions focused on SQL.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
8. Can you explain the Django section of the course?

The Django section includes `Networking Concept`, `MVC MVT Concepts`, `Startproject and Folder Structure`, `Startapp`, `URL View`, `HTTP Response`, `Template Handling`, `Admin Panel`, `ORM Model`, and creating a `Django Forum App`.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
9. What does the Twitter Clone project involve?
The Twitter Clone project is a practical application where you'll use your skills to create a functional clone of Twitter, applying `HTML`, `CSS`, `JavaScript`, and `Django`.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
10. What will I learn in the React section of the course?

The React module covers topics like setting up a `React App`, `JSX`, `Components`, `Props`, `State Management` with `UseState` and `UseEffect`, `Fetching Data from APIs`, `React Router`, `UseContext Hook`, `React-Query`, `React-Hook-Form`, `Custom Hooks`, and `TypeScript`.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
11. What is included in the Portfolio section of the course?

The Portfolio section helps you build your own web development portfolio. It covers `Visual Studio Code extensions and tips`, planning with tools like `Trello` and `Adobe XD`, creating a `GitHub repository`, and coding various sections of your portfolio such as `Navbar`, `About`, and `Projects`. Finally, you'll learn about deploying your portfolio using platforms like `Replit`.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
12. What are the learning outcomes from the Django module?

The Django module will equip you with a comprehensive understanding of Django's `MVC` and `MVT` concepts, project and app setup, `URL routing`, `views`, `HTTP responses`, `template handling`, `admin panel`, `ORM models`, and creating a `forum app`. This module prepares you for both backend development and practical Django applications.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
13. How is JavaScript taught in the course?

The JavaScript module starts with the basics and gradually moves to advanced concepts. You'll learn about `JavaScript syntax`, `operators`, `conditionals`, `functions`, `scope`, `arrays`, `loops`, `iterators`, and practical applications. The module also includes interview questions to prepare you for JavaScript-related job interviews.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
14. Can you describe the SQL module in detail?

The SQL module in the course covers a broad range of topics starting from the basics of `SQL queries`, `joins`, and `table manipulation`. You'll learn about using `expressions and aggregates`, managing `rows and tables`, writing `subqueries`, and understanding `unions`, `intersections`, and `exceptions`. The module also prepares you for SQL interviews with a dedicated set of questions.
Mentor is a Techis chatbot
15. What does the Twitter Clone project involve?

In the Twitter Clone project, you will apply your learnings to create a functional clone of Twitter. This project is designed to give you practical experience in web development, allowing you to implement and consolidate your skills in `HTML`, `CSS`, `JavaScript`, and backend technologies like `Django`.
